results.title: The Honour of Cochise
results.creator_credit: National Broadcasting Company, David Dortort and Don McDougall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Three of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 10/8/61), the Cartwrights and a bigoted army captain who takes refuge with them are pinned down by Cochise and his braves. The Cartwrights make camp on their way home, then suddenly have to come to the defense of Army Captain, Moss Johnson, running from an Apache attack. Ben and his sons find themselves surrounded by Cochise and his people who refuse to leave without Johnson. Ben agrees to hear Cochise’s side of the story and learns that Captain Johnson called Cochise and his people together to talk of peace and used the opportunity to poison them. Adam is shot trying to get water and now Ben faces a dilemma, turn Johnson over to Cochise, or try to go for help and leave his son’s to defend him. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and Jeff Morrow.

results.title: The Honeymooners
results.creator_credit: CBS, Jackie Gleason Enterprises, Jack Hurdle and Frank Satenstein
results.brief_description: The Honeymooners was a popular television comedy that started as a sketch show and due to its success was produced as a series. The live show was set in a Brooklyn apartment focusing on two lower middle class neighbouring couples trying to make their lives better. The main character Ralph (Jackie Gleason), a bus driver, is constantly at loggerheads with his wife, Alice (Audrey Meadows) who always make up by the end of the show. This video presentation includes one episode, “TV or not TV” and a montage tribute of the show presenting highlights and memorable moments. The episode shows what happens when the couples decide to jointly own a television set and the strains it places on their friendship. Interestingly “The Flintstones” cartoon was based on the characters from “The Honeymooners” placing them in a pre-historic setting.

results.title: The Honest truth
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Spencer and Gudrun Parker
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “What Do You Think”.
This film poses the question of whether an honest judgment is better than diplomatic double-talk in situations where an individual’s feelings may be hurt. We listen in on the conversation of high-school teen-agers following a school play in which a popular but untalented student has the leading role. The editor of the school paper defends his right to print an objective critical review of her performance. Other students feel that she should be let down more gently. The audience is invited to take over discussion of the issue.

results.title: The Homicide story
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions and HSV Channel 7, Melbourne
results.brief_description: The story of the making of one episode of the successful Australian television series - Homicide. From the idea for a story in the mind of a writer to the finished product - a matter of fourteen weeks intensive planning and work. We follow all steps of production: from the writing of the script to the final telerecording of thirty minutes of television.

results.title: The Hometown
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jack Long and Bettina Matzkuhn
results.brief_description: A collection of tapestries designed and sewn by the filmmaker, Bettina Matzkuhn, illustrate the lyrics of a song about a young girl’s hometown. Animation is created through a combination of sewing and cinematic techniques. The needlework, done in a naive style, is well suited to the bright colours and varied textures of the work. A lively film designed to promote interest in the art of tapestry

results.title: The Homecoming
results.creator_credit: American Express Films, Ely Landau Organization, Ely Landau and Peter Hall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Lauded and much admired adaptation of the caustic Harold Pinter play about three estranged brothers and their father. When one son - an accomplished university professor - visits from America with his wife, the family are reunited in their London home only to find that tension and malevolence simmers dangerously below their every interaction. As a study of male violence, family dysfunction, rage and suppressed emotion, Pinter’s screenplay shines even if the characters’ motivations are opaque, and their capacity for hatred, disturbing. Cast includes: Vivien Merchant, Terence Rigby, Paul Rogers, Cyril Cusack, Michael Jayston, and Ian Holm who is brilliant as the menacing pimp, Lenny.

results.title: The Home Planet
results.creator_credit: KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.) and Barry Stoner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
The home planet is the final volume of “The miracle planet” series and looks at some of the major questions confronting the human race. With our population growing, the supply of our resources dwindling, our atmosphere threatened, and the spectre of malnutrition and starvation haunting more and more of the Earth’s population, what are the prospects for the planet continuing to support human life?

results.title: The Home made car
results.brief_description: Follows the rebuilding of an old Morris car in a home workshop, without commentary. The story of the man, his dog, and a dream which includes the girl next door, a torrid ten year old, a garage man and, of course, “the car”.
